titleStmt.title: A schole of wise conceytes vvherin as euery conceyte hath wit, so the most haue much mirth, set forth in common places by order of the alphabet. Translated out of diuers Greke and Latine wryters, by Thomas Blage student of the Queenes Colledge in Cambridge.

A schole of wise conceytes vvherin as euery conceyte hath wit, so the most haue much mirth, set forth in common places by order of the alphabet. Translated out of diuers Greke and Latine wryters, by Thomas Blage student of the Queenes Colledge in Cambridge.
titleStmt.author: Blague, Thomas, d. 1611.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Henrie Binneman, dwelling in Knight rider streate, at the signe of the Marmayd,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: Wittie fayned sayings of men, beasts, and foules.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
